channel.title: Comments on: Bash script to download MODIS data
channel.description: Research focused on biogeography, spatial ecology and landscape change at Kent State University

item.title: By: swati
item.dc:creator: swati
item.description:
Hi ,
Tried today but it downloaded files with 1kb volume ..?? nothing was there in the hdf files and modisHDF function is not accepted by R.
item.content:encoded:
Hi ,

Tried today but it downloaded files with 1kb volume ..??
nothing was there in the hdf files and modisHDF function is not accepted by R.

item.title: By: tim.assal@gmail.com
item.dc:creator: tim.assal@gmail.com
item.description:
Hello-
Yes, I believe the additional NASA Earthdata login and password will need to be incorporated into the script. I have not had a chance to update my script yet, but here is some information I received from NASA LP DAAC.
Have a look at the DAAC2Disk tool:
https://lpdaac.usgs.gov/data_access/data_pool
See the link to a Command Line Tips document that you might find helpful if you are using curl or wget to download your data.
And make sure that your URS login profile is authorized to use the data pool.
https://urs.earthdata.nasa.gov/
Select the My Applications tab and add data pool to the list if it isn't already there. This way you can add your user id and password in your script and you won't have to worry about it.
Good luck.
item.content:encoded:
Hello-

Yes, I believe the additional NASA Earthdata login and password will need to be incorporated into the script. I have not had a chance to update my script yet, but here is some information I received from NASA LP DAAC.

Have a look at the DAAC2Disk tool:

https://lpdaac.usgs.gov/data_access/data_pool

See the link to a Command Line Tips document that you might find helpful if you are using curl or wget to download your data.

And make sure that your URS login profile is authorized to use the data pool.

https://urs.earthdata.nasa.gov/

Select the My Applications tab and add data pool to the list if it isn’t already there. This way you can add your user id and password in your script and you won’t have to worry about it.

Good luck.
